sentences: Jeong Hye-yoon (Korean: 정혜윤; born October 1, 1996) known as Heyoon Jeong,  is a South Korean dancer, singer, rapper and choreographer.
She represents South Korea in the global pop group Now United.
Before joining Now United, she was known for her choreography videos on YouTube.
Biography ==
Heyoon was born in Daejeon, South Korea on October 1, 1996.
At the age of three, Heyoon started practicing ballet.
A few years later, she decided that she wanted to become a musician.
In 2015, she moved to Seoul to pursue a professional career in the music industry.
Career ==
=== 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: On November 15, 2017, Heyoon was revealed as part of the final lineup for global pop group Now United.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: In December of the same year, the group released their first single, "Summer in the City".
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: In August 2020, the single "Nobody Fools Me Twice" was released.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: Heyoon states the release of the single to being one of her biggest highlights as a member of the group, as the song is entirely in Korean.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: On September 18, 2020, the music video for "The Weekend's Here" was released.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: The track features Heyoon along with Sofya, Sina, and Savannah.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: She served as the co-director for the music video, along with Dima Kovalchuk.
section: == Career == | === 2015–present: Early career and Now United ===

sentences: On September 30, 2020, Now United released the music video for a song called "Somebody", where one of the clip's directors is Heyoon again.
